001package imagingbook.lib.util;
002
003import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
004import java.io.PrintStream;
005import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
006import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
007import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
008import java.lang.annotation.Target;
009import java.lang.reflect.Field;
010import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
011
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013
014
015/**
016 * Interface to be implemented by local 'Parameters' classes.
017 * This is part of the 'simple parameter object' scheme,
018 * working with public fields.
019 * Only non-static, non-final, public fields are accepted as parameters.
020 * 
021 * Current features:
022 * (a) Makes parameter bundles printable by listing all eligible fields.
023 * 
024 * (b) Parameter bundles can be added/modified as a whole by ImageJ's 
025 * {@link GenericDialog}, supported by specific annotations.
026 * Use methods {@link #addToDialog(GenericDialog)} and 
027 * {@link #getFromDialog(GenericDialog)}.
028 * 
029 * See the example in {@code DemoParameters} below.
030 * Other functionality may be added in the future.
031 * 
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2022/02/02
034 */
035public interface ParameterBundle {
036        
037        default String printToString() {
038                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
039                try (PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas)) {
040                        printToStream(strm);
041                }
042                return bas.toString();
043        }
044
045        default void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
046                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = this.getClass();
047                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
048//              strm.println(clazz.getCanonicalName());
049                for (Field field : fields) {
050                        if (!isValidParameterItem(field)) {
051                                continue;
052                        }
053                        strm.print(field.getType().getSimpleName() + " ");
054                        strm.print(field.getName() + " = ");
055                        try {
056                                strm.print(field.get(this).toString());
057                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { }       
058                        strm.println();
059//                      int modifiers = field.getModifiers();
060//                      strm.println("Field is public = " + Modifier.isPublic(modifiers));
061//                      strm.println("Field is final = " + Modifier.isFinal(modifiers));
062                }
063        }
064        
065        /**
066         * Validates the correctness and compatibility of the
067         * parameters in this bundle. 
068         * Implementing classes should override this method.
069         * @return true if all parameters are OK, false otherwise
070         */
071        default boolean validate() {
072                return true;
073        }
074        
075        // ---- Dialog-related annotations to be used on individual parameter fields ------
076        
077        
078        /**
079         * Annotation to specify a specific 'label' to be shown for following
080         * parameter fields. Default label is the variable name.
081         */
082        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
083        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
084        public @interface DialogLabel {
085                public String value();
086        }
087        
088        /**
089         * Annotation to specify the number of digits displayed when showing
090         * numeric values in dialogs.
091         * This annotation has no effect on non-floating-point fields.
092         */
093        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
094        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
095        public @interface DialogDigits {
096                public int value();
097        }
098        
099        /**
100         * Annotation to always hide the following parameter field in dialogs.
101         */
102        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
103        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
104        public @interface DialogHide {
105        }
106        
107        // ------------ ImageJ dialog-related (TODO: move to another interface?) ------------------
108        
109        /**
110         * Adds all qualified fields of this parameter bundle to the specified
111         * {@link GenericDialog} instance, in the order of their definition.
112         * Qualified means that the field is of suitable type and no 
113         * {@link DialogHide} annotation is present.
114         * 
115         * @param gd a generic dialog
116         */
117        public default void addToDialog(GenericDialog gd) {
118                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = this.getClass();
119                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
120                for (Field f : fields) {
121                        if (!isValidParameterItem(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogHide.class)) {
122                                continue;
123                        }
124                        try {
125                                addFieldToDialog(f, gd);
126                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { }
127                }
128        }
129        
130        public default boolean getFromDialog(GenericDialog gd) {
131                Class<? extends ParameterBundle> clazz = this.getClass();
132                Field[] fields = clazz.getFields();             // gets only public fields
133                int errorCount = 0;
134                for (Field f : fields) {
135                        if (!isValidParameterItem(f) || f.isAnnotationPresent(DialogHide.class)) {
136                                continue;
137                        }
138                        try {
139                                if (!getFieldFromDialog(f, gd)) {
140                                        errorCount++;
141                                }
142                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e) { }
143                }
144                return (errorCount == 0);
145        }
146        
147        static boolean isValidParameterItem(Field f) {
148                int mod = f.getModifiers();
149                if (Modifier.isPrivate(mod) || Modifier.isFinal(mod) || Modifier.isStatic(mod)) {
150                        return false;
151                }
152                Class<?> clazz = f.getType();
153                if (clazz == boolean.class || clazz == int.class || clazz == float.class || clazz == double.class || 
154                        clazz == String.class || clazz.isEnum())
155                        return true;
156                else
157                        return true;
158        }
159        
160        static void printModifiers(Field f) {
161                int mod = f.getModifiers();
162                System.out.println("Modifiers of field " + f.getName());
163                System.out.println("abstract     = " + Modifier.isAbstract(mod));
164                System.out.println("final        = " + Modifier.isFinal(mod));
165                System.out.println("interface    = " + Modifier.isInterface(mod));
166                System.out.println("native       = " + Modifier.isNative(mod));
167                System.out.println("private      = " + Modifier.isPrivate(mod));
168                System.out.println("protected    = " + Modifier.isProtected(mod));
169                System.out.println("public       = " + Modifier.isPublic(mod));
170                System.out.println("static       = " + Modifier.isStatic(mod));
171                System.out.println("strict       = " + Modifier.isStrict(mod));
172                System.out.println("synchronized = " + Modifier.isSynchronized(mod));
173                System.out.println("transient    = " + Modifier.isTransient(mod));
174                System.out.println("volatite     = " + Modifier.isVolatile(mod));
175        }
176        
177        /**
178         * Adds the specified {@link Field} of this object as new item to 
179         * the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
180         * The name of the field is used as the 'label' of the dialog item.
181         * TODO: this could/should be private!
182         * 
183         * @param field some field
184         * @param dialog the dialog
185         * @throws IllegalAccessException when field is accessed illegally
186         */
187        default void addFieldToDialog(Field field, GenericDialog dialog)
188                        throws IllegalAccessException {
189                
190                String name = field.getName();
191                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogLabel.class)) {
192                        name = field.getAnnotation(DialogLabel.class).value();
193                }
194                
195                int digits = 2; // DefaultDialogDigits;
196                if (field.isAnnotationPresent(DialogDigits.class)) {
197                        digits = field.getAnnotation(DialogDigits.class).value();
198                        digits = Math.max(0,  digits);
199                }
200                
201                Class<?> clazz = field.getType();
202                if  (clazz.equals(boolean.class)) {
203                        dialog.addCheckbox(name, field.getBoolean(this));
204                }
205                else if (clazz.equals(int.class)) {
206                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getInt(this), 0);
207                }
208                else if (clazz.equals(float.class)) {
209                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getFloat(this), digits);
210                }
211                else if (clazz.equals(double.class)) {
212                        dialog.addNumericField(name, field.getDouble(this), digits);
213                }
214                else if (clazz.equals(String.class)) {
215                        String str = (String) field.get(this);
216                        dialog.addStringField(name, str);
217                }
218                else if (clazz.isEnum()) {
219                        dialog.addEnumChoice(name, (Enum<?>) field.get(this));
220                }
221                else {
222                        // ignore this field
223                        //throw new RuntimeException("cannot handle field of type " + clazz);
224                }
225        }
226
227        /**
228         * Modifies the specified {@link Field} of this object by reading the next item
229         * from the {@link GenericDialog} instance.
230         * TODO: this could/should be private!
231         * 
232         * @param field a publicly accessible {@link Field} of this object 
233         * @param gd a {@link GenericDialog} instance
234         * @return true if successful
235         * @throws IllegalAccessException illegal field access
236         */
237        @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
238        default boolean getFieldFromDialog(Field field, GenericDialog gd) 
239                                        throws IllegalAccessException {
240                Class<?> clazz = field.getType();
241                if  (clazz.equals(boolean.class)) {
242                        field.setBoolean(this, gd.getNextBoolean());
243                }
244                else if (clazz.equals(int.class)) {
245                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
246                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
247                                return false;
248                        }
249                        field.setInt(this, (int) val);
250                }
251                else if (clazz.equals(float.class)) {
252                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
253                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
254                                return false;
255                        }
256                        field.setFloat(this, (float) val);
257                }
258                else if (clazz.equals(double.class)) {
259                        double val = gd.getNextNumber();
260                        if (Double.isNaN(val)) {
261                                return false;
262                        }
263                        field.setDouble(this, val);
264                }
265                else if (clazz.equals(String.class)) {
266                        String str = gd.getNextString();
267                        if (str == null) {
268                                return false;
269                        }
270                        field.set(this, str);
271                }
272                else if (clazz.isEnum()) {
273                        Enum en = gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<Enum>) clazz);
274                        if (en == null) {
275                                return false;
276                        }
277                        field.set(this, en);
278//                      field.set(instance, gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<? extends Enum>) clazz));       // works                        
279//                      field.set(instance, gd.getNextEnumChoice((Class<Enum>) clazz)); // works        
280                }
281                else {
282                        // ignore this field
283                        // throw new RuntimeException("cannot handle field of type " + clazz);
284                }
285                return true;
286        }
287        
288        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
289        
290//      enum MyEnum {
291//              A, B, Cee
292//      }
293//
294//      /**
295//       * Example parameter bundle
296//       */
297//      static class DemoParameters implements ParameterBundle {
298//              public static int staticInt = 44;       // currently static members are listed too!
299//              
300//              @DialogLabel("Make a decision:")
301//              public boolean someBool = true;
302//              public int someInt = 39;
303//              public float someFloat = 1.99f;
304//              
305//              @DialogLabel("Math.PI")@DialogDigits(10)
306//              public double someDouble = Math.PI;
307//              public String someString = "SHOW ME";
308//              
309//              @DialogHide
310//              public String hiddenString = "HIDE ME";
311//              public MyEnum someEnum = MyEnum.B;
312//      }
313//      
314//      public static void main(String[] args) {
315//              
316//              ParameterBundle params = new DemoParameters();
317//              System.out.println("p1 = \n" + params.printToString());
318//              
319//              GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(ParameterBundle.class.getSimpleName());
320//              gd.addNumericField("some single int", 123, 0);
321//              params.addToDialog(gd);
322//              
323//              gd.showDialog();
324//              if (gd.wasCanceled())
325//                      return;
326//              
327//              @SuppressWarnings("unused")
328//              int singleInt = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
329//              boolean success = params.getFromDialog(gd);
330//              System.out.println("success = " + success);
331//              System.out.println("p2 = \n" + params.printToString());
332//      }
333        
334}
